translation.en: [Steve] A few years ago, we got a call
translation.ko: 몇 년 전, 신시내티 소아 병원의

translation.en: from the head oncologist at Cincinnati Children's Hospital.
He was looking for someone to make a documentary
translation.ko: 그는 소아암 환자가 있는 가정에서 겪는 일에 관해

translation.en: about what a family goes through when their kid has cancer.
translation.ko: 다큐멘터리를 제작해 줄 사람을 찾고 있었습니다

translation.en: We drove down to Cincinnati to hear more.
translation.ko: 우리는 그를 만나기 위해 신시내티로 갔습니다

translation.en: [Julia] The thing he didn't know is that our own daughter had just finished
translation.ko: 그는 우리 딸이 얼마 전에 항암 치료를 마쳤다는 걸

translation.en: her treatment for cancer.
It had been a tough year, and we were all trying to get life back to normal.
translation.ko: 힘겨운 한 해를 보낸 우리는 일상으로 돌아오려 애쓰고 있었습니다

translation.en: So making this movie, and going back into the world of cancer,
translation.ko: 그래서 이 영화를 제작하고 암의 세계로 되돌아가는 게

translation.en: didn't seem like something we would wanna do.
But we said yes, almost right away.
[Steve] We didn't know where the stories would take us or how many years would go by.
translation.ko: 이야기가 어떻게 흘러갈지 몇 년이 걸릴지 우린 몰랐습니다

translation.en: But we did know that no one would be the same by the end.
translation.ko: 분명한 건 마지막엔 모두가 변하리라는 사실뿐이었죠

translation.en: And so we began meeting the families who let us into their lives.

We pray in your name. Amen.

She said, I told her... she said I woke her up and she said okay she was getting up.

translation.en: and putting IVs in and I'm sitting' there like,
"Okay, nobody's still told me nothin'," you know,

There's three pills we'd like him to take.

Sleep.

Justin?

Grandma's baby boy.

Hi. Hi.

Well, no, I don't like coming here.

translation.en: -Well. -But, no, I don't like to come here.
translation.ko: - 맞아 - 그러니까 - 난 여기 오는 거 싫어 - 알아, 싫어하는 거

translation.en: I know you don't, sweetie.
translation.ko: - 난 여기 오는 거 싫어 - 알아, 싫어하는 거

translation.en: Especially, you know, since there's not just Justin.
There's so many other little kids floating through here.
[Dale] What's his name, Zwerdling?
Yeah. Zwerdling must have told Linda that he wants to meet with you and Dale today.
translation.ko: 즈워들링이 린다에게 오늘 두 사람을 만나고 싶다고 한 모양이에요

translation.en: And it's probably their Doomsday meeting that they give you,
so, to try to tell you what's gonna happen, how it's coming down.
translation.ko: 앞으로 어떻게 되는 건지 말해 주는 거죠

translation.en: [Julia] Even though it's Sunday, this month's attending physician,
translation.ko: 오늘은 일요일인데도 이번 달의 담당의인 즈워들링 박사가

translation.en: Dr. Zwerdling, calls a meeting with Justin's parents.
translation.ko: 이번 달의 담당의인 즈워들링 박사가 저스틴의 부모에게 만남을 청합니다

translation.en: I've had experiences like this before
and it becomes agonizing because...
[Julia] Ted Zwerdling is also the medical director of Hospice at Children's.
translation.ko: 테드 즈워들링은 소아 병원의 호스피스 센터장이기도 합니다

translation.en: The end is gonna be the same, you're not gonna survive,
but it slows and it takes weeks and weeks.
translation.ko: 대신 진행이 느려져서 여러 주가 걸리는 거죠

translation.en: -If he's gonna not get better... -Mm-hm.
...we'd like it to be quick so people don't suffer.
On the other hand, uh, it's so unpredictable.
translation.ko: 하지만 한편으로는 이게 정말 예측이 안 돼요

translation.en: I think three weeks ago, you wouldn't have predicted
translation.ko: 하지만 한편으로는 이게 정말 예측이 안 돼요 3주 전만 해도 우리가 오늘 이런 얘기를 하게 될 거라곤

translation.en: that we'd be sitting here today, having this discussion.
translation.ko: 3주 전만 해도 우리가 오늘 이런 얘기를 하게 될 거라곤 상상도 못 하셨을 겁니다

translation.en: He's a fighter though. He is a fighter. And I'm a fighter.
translation.ko: 하지만 저스틴은 강해요 - 저도 그렇고요 - 맞아요

translation.en: -I... -[Dale] Yeah.
-We don't ever give up. -No.
translation.ko: - 우린 포기 안 해요 - 안 해요

translation.en: -Sometimes there's a time you give up... -No.
Not there yet.
At some point you get rid of all this sort of peripheral medical stuff
translation.ko: 언젠가는 이런 지엽적인 의료 행위를 중단하고

translation.en: and you say, you know, "How do you want your son to die?
translation.ko: 아들의 죽음을 의논해야 할 때가 옵니다

translation.en: Do you want us to resuscitate him to die in the ICU
translation.ko: 지금 소생시켜서 집중 치료실에서 죽게 할지

translation.en: or do you want him to just die here?"
We touched on that about going home and that's when I made it clear to them
that if they decide that they want him home,
you know, we could put him in hospice and he could go home on hospice
translation.ko: 집에서 호스피스 케어를 받는 것도 가능하니

translation.en: and you know, do whatever they want.
translation.ko: 집에서 호스피스 케어를 받는 것도 가능하니 뭐든 원하는 대로 해도 된다고요

translation.en: I think they're not really focusing on leukemia at this point.
translation.ko: 지금 의사들의 초점은 백혈병이 아닌 것 같아요

translation.en: But, um, just, you know, what's going on with his life.
translation.ko: 그보다는 저스틴의 삶 자체를 생각하는 거죠

translation.en: But I'm still focusing on leukemia.
I've been fighting for ten years and I just feel like I still need to be in focus with that.
translation.ko: 백혈병과 10년을 싸워 왔는데 이렇게 놓아 버릴 순 없잖아요

translation.en: You knock at the door, you knock at the door, and you open it a little bit and then, you let it close back
translation.ko: 끈질기게 문을 두드려서 조금 열렸다가 다시 닫히면

translation.en: and go to something else and then do it again
translation.ko: 끈질기게 문을 두드려서 조금 열렸다가 다시 닫히면 다시 다른 문을 두드리기 시작하는 거죠

translation.en: because it tells me that, you know,
she has always been very realistic about everything,
translation.ko: 데비는 모든 면에서 항상 굉장히 현실적이었고

translation.en: I have never know her to be, um,
one of these people who won't look at what's going on.
But there's the realism that you think about with your mind and your brain
translation.ko: 하지만 머리로 알고 뇌로 인식하는 현실과

translation.en: and your, you know, and then, there's you know your son and your heart
translation.ko: 하지만 머리로 알고 뇌로 인식하는 현실과 마음이 받아들이는 아들의 현실은 별개예요

translation.en: and all that stuff and I think she's still a little bit
translation.ko: 마음이 받아들이는 아들의 현실은 별개예요 데비는 아직…

translation.en: a part of that.
[Julia] Judy takes turns with Scott on overnight shifts with Alex,
translation.ko: 주디는 스콧과 교대로 앨릭스의 야간 간호를 합니다

translation.en: but she also has a project with her younger daughter, Jackie.
translation.ko: 동시에 앨릭스의 여동생인 재키도 보살펴야 합니다

translation.en: And she would call these people and she would say, "Hi, it's J..."
-You know, she's got a very low voice. -[Julia] Mm-hm.
[in low voice] "Hi, it's Jackie.
I'm selling Girl Scout cookies, do you want to buy any?"
And they'd go, "Well, of course I do. What kind do you have?"
"Uh..." And she'd look at the pictures and she goes,
"There's some chocolate ones."
But at the time she was feeling good,
and I thought this would be perfect. I can get involved with Jackie
translation.ko: 그래서 생각한 거예요 재키랑 같이 브라우니를 팔고

translation.en: and Brownies and be the cookie manager and...
translation.ko: 그래서 생각한 거예요 재키랑 같이 브라우니를 팔고 '쿠키 매니저'가 되고…

translation.en: -[Julia] She'd be all proud of you. -Oh, yeah.
-Center of attention. -Well, no, I would be proud of myself
translation.ko: - 많은 관심을 받을 테니까요 - 저도 제가 자랑스러울 거예요

translation.en: 'cause I've done something with her because for so many years
translation.ko: 재키와 뭔가를 했다는 것만으로도요 재키는 너무 오랫동안…

translation.en: she's just been kind of,
here and there shoved aside, you know. You hate to say that but...
translation.ko: 인정하고 싶진 않지만 이리저리 밀려난 게 사실이죠

translation.en: And then, she's joined basketball this year already,
so, and she's in gymnastics, so we're trying to work around
brownies, gymnastics, basketball and then, this one gets sick.
translation.ko: 브라우니, 체조, 농구까지 챙겨 주던 차에 앨릭스가 아파진 거예요

translation.en: -I know. -So...
Well, but she's... Yeah, and she's also a little bit different
translation.ko: "로라 화이트 소아과 전임의" 그런데 아이가… 맞아요, 그리고 좀 특수한 경우죠

translation.en: in the sense that she's had a low ANC for a long, long, long time.
translation.ko: 맞아요, 그리고 좀 특수한 경우죠 ANC가 아주 오랫동안 낮았어요

translation.en: [Julia] Alex's white blood count, her ANC, is near zero,
translation.ko: 앨릭스의 백혈구 수 즉, ANC는 0에 가깝습니다

translation.en: which means she can't fight the infection in her eye and nose.
translation.ko: 눈과 코의 감염을 이겨 낼 수 없다는 뜻입니다

translation.en: Look at those red spots on her.
Are those new?
What are those?
-Well, I don't know. -[chuckles]
Here's one.
Does that hurt, sweetie? Okay.
Can I check your back real quick and see if it's on your back too?
translation.ko: 등에도 있는지 선생님이 잠깐만 봐도 될까?

translation.en: -Look at her stomach. Stomach. -No.
She doesn't wanna be examined.
She's got them all over her stomach and legs.
translation.ko: 배랑 다리에 저런 게 잔뜩 생겼어요

translation.en: Yeah, I'm gonna tell Rog about the rash though 'cause that's new,
translation.ko: 새로 생긴 발진이라 로지랑 얘기해 봐야겠어요

translation.en: I just wonder about that.
Spots on her chest, back, thorax, legs, arms.
translation.ko: 가슴, 등, 흉곽, 다리, 팔에 반점이 있어요

translation.en: I asked them, I said, "What are these red bumps?" "I don't know, we haven't seen those before on her."
translation.ko: 빨간 돌기가 뭐냐고 물었더니 자기들도 처음 봤다는 거예요

translation.en: You know, like the chicken pox?
[Julia] Paul tells Judy it's not chicken pox,
just an allergic reaction to her antibiotics.
You know what? She had some right here too.
Mm-hm. She's got them all over her legs...
-Do they think it's from antibiotics? -Oh, yeah.
So they're going to change her antibiotics?
Because they said, "If it's shingles, you're stuck here for the next couple weeks with her."
translation.ko: 대상포진이면 앞으로 몇 주는 여기 있어야 한대

translation.en: Psych. [laughs]
He's doing wonderful.
I'm just happy about everything. [laughs]
Neurology came in and they asked him his first and last name,
and he knew it, he knew the year.
They were ecstatic. They just said, "Justin you're amazing."
translation.ko: 의사들도 정말 기뻐했죠 저스틴이 대단하다고 했어요

translation.en: And they said, "It just seems like he's getting better every day."
Neurology actually came by this morning and Mom is really, um,
translation.ko: 아침에 신경과에서 왔었는데 많이 좋아졌다고 하니

translation.en: pleased because they said he's doing so much better.
I'm not really convinced that he's better.
I think he's recovered from the post-operative, uh, phase,
translation.ko: 수술 후의 상태에서 회복됐다고 볼 수는 있지만

translation.en: but I don't think he's any better, and the oxygen requirement is new, so...
translation.ko: 나아졌다고 할 수는 없고 산소 공급도 필요해져서…

translation.en: [Dr. Zwerdling] One of the problems with sub-specialists is that
they will come in and they have blinders on.
Okay, we'll get the brain condition better,
but what are we gonna do about the leukemia?
And what are we gonna do about the infection?
And we are we gonna do about the lungs?
I always wonder what he's thinking about,
translation.ko: 애가 무슨 생각을 하는지 늘 궁금해요

translation.en: what's going on in his mind, you know,
translation.ko: 저 머릿속에 어떤 생각이 들어 있을지가요

translation.en: like "Please don't leave me laying here.
Respond to me."
Do you know what this is?
Do you know what this is?
Can you squeeze my fingers?
Squeeze real hard. Show me how strong you are this morning, okay?
translation.ko: 세게 잡아 봐, 오늘 아침엔 힘이 얼마나 센지 보자

translation.en: [Debbie] He was so alert, Ted.
This morning he was just, um... I was ecstatic.
translation.ko: 오늘 아침엔 정말… - 얼마나 좋았다고요 - 그래요

translation.en: -[laughs] Just... -Yeah.
When Zwerdling comes in its, ah, he's just Dr. Doom and Gloom. [chuckles]
translation.ko: 즈워들링 박사님은… 그분은 우울한 얘기만 해요

translation.en: I just kind of avoid him now.
[Dr. Zwerdling] There's a huge difference between being negative and realistic,
translation.ko: 부정적인 것과 현실적인 건 큰 차이가 있습니다

translation.en: although the line can be quite fine.
I don't feel like I've been negative, just, as realistic
translation.ko: 제가 부정적이라고 생각하지는 않아요 그저 현실적으로 말해 주고

translation.en: and as, giving them my best opinion.
translation.ko: 그저 현실적으로 말해 주고 최대한 정확한 의견을 말해 주는 거죠

translation.en: So basically what we're going to ask mom is,
translation.ko: 아이 엄마한테 이걸 확인해야 하는 거죠

translation.en: in case something were to happen, do you still want everything done?
translation.ko: '무슨 일이 일어났을 때 할 수 있는 걸 다 해 볼 것인가?' "조 팔룸보 종양과 전임의"

translation.en: Just ask it as a question. If she says yes, just say that's fine, and then just leave it at that.
translation.ko: 물어봐서 그걸 원한다고 하면 그렇게 하면 되고요

translation.en: Who has legal custody?
-Mom. -[female doctor] Mom.
-[laughing] -[male doctor] Jump. Okay.
This could be scary.
[male doctor] Yeah, I know, it's all, all intimidation by numbers.
I don't want him hooked up and just keep running for my own...
translation.ko: 제 욕심 때문에 애를 기계에 연결해 놓는 건 원치 않아요

translation.en: -[male doctor] Yeah, right. -You know, he would hate it.
-Mm-hm. -But I still want you to do whatever. Okay.
translation.ko: - 그래도 뭐든 해 주시면 좋겠어요 - 좋아요

translation.en: Cause I don't feel like he's at the ladder.
translation.ko: 아직 마지막까지 간 것 같진 않아서요

translation.en: -Okay. -You know, he's going in that direction,
-but I still have this hope. [laughs] -Right, right.
translation.ko: - 전 아직 희망을 갖고 있어요 - 알겠어요

translation.en: That, I mean, 'cause that's just the way he's been.
And until we get information to the contrary
from the pathologist or from Justin's clinical status then...
translation.ko: 병리과에서 안 좋은 결론이 나오거나 저스틴의 임상 상태가 나빠지면 그때…

translation.en: -Right. -Okay.
The important thing was she felt like she got the issues addressed
translation.ko: 중요한 건 환자의 엄마가 짚고 넘어가고 싶었던 걸

translation.en: that she wanted addressed and she felt comfortable with our plan,
translation.ko: 짚고 넘어갔고 저희 계획에 만족했다는 거죠

translation.en: so I think it went well.
I think it was very overly optimistic.
I mean, talk about intervention with C-lines and TPM.
translation.ko: C 라인과 TPM 사용 얘기를 하고…

translation.en: I would have probably...
-But do you know... -...cautioned against that.
No, I don't know. I don't know what's gonna happen,
but I do know that since I've come on service
translation.ko: 하지만 내가 저스틴을 봐 온 이래로

translation.en: his neurological exam has deteriorated
and he now has an oxygen requirement. He didn't have those two.
I think Mom is aware of that. You heard the way she talked at the end.
translation.ko: 엄마도 알고 있는 것 같아요 마지막에 하는 얘기 들었잖아요

translation.en: -I haven't been able to put her together. -I think, you know, she...
translation.ko: - 준비가 안 돼 있어요 - 저스틴 엄마는 그냥…

translation.en: She just wants, uh, just a few days.
translation.ko: - 준비가 안 돼 있어요 - 저스틴 엄마는 그냥… 며칠만 시간을 갖고 싶은 것 같아요

translation.en: I think she's just looking for a few days to process all this.
translation.ko: 받아들일 시간이 며칠 필요한 것 같아요

translation.en: It's just a different way of handling it.
She wasn't the one pushing for the C-line. It was Bob, and us.
translation.ko: C 라인은 아이 엄마가 아니라 밥이랑 우리가 제안한 거예요

translation.en: You guys. [laughs] Not Dr. Zwerdling.
The dining room.
[Julia] If the oxygen saturation in Justin's blood slips below 90%,
it's dangerous.
If it falls into the fifties he could have permanent brain damage.
translation.ko: 50%대까지 떨어지면 영구적 뇌 손상의 위험이 있습니다

translation.en: [Dr. Malini] I have a twenty-year-old patient who desatted very acutely down to the fifties.
[Steve] Doctor Gillen is a new resident.
She starts her month rotation tonight.
translation.ko: 오늘 밤부터 한 달간의 로테이션을 시작합니다

translation.en: -[Susan] Deep breaths. -[Debbie] Aw.
They dropped to like 57.
-My goodness. -Yeah.
I was just saying how good you were.
Inhale, exhale. Inhale, exhale.
[Julia] Because Justin wants everything done,
translation.ko: 모든 방법을 시도해 보길 원하는 저스틴의 뜻에 따라

translation.en: the staff feel they have to move him to the ICU.
Where we are right now is sort of at the maximum that can be done here.
translation.ko: 지금 여기서 할 수 있는 모든 걸 다 하고 있어요 "대니얼스 집중 치료실 의사"

translation.en: -Right. -We're there.
I know where you're coming from but I don't think
translation.ko: 무슨 말씀인지 알아요 하지만 저스틴을 위해서도

translation.en: it would be of a benefit as of yet for him.
translation.ko: 하지만 저스틴을 위해서도 아직 그건 좋을 게 없는 것 같아요

translation.en: Mom doesn't want to come up right now, so that takes care of that.
translation.ko: 지금은 엄마가 올라가는 걸 원치 않네요

translation.en: Right, right. He is, he is full code status
intubate, full everything.
We can't go any further than 15 liters.
Right.
He shouldn't be down here at 15 liters.
Jack wanted him up an hour ago
and she said no, she didn't want him back up there,
translation.ko: 그런데 엄마가 올라가고 싶지 않다고 했죠

translation.en: but she wasn't going to change his code status.
We're not offering you the best options,
translation.ko: 저희가 할 수 있는 것들은 큰 도움이 되지는 못해요

translation.en: we're offering you like, what's... What's the lowest risk?
translation.ko: 큰 도움이 되지는 못해요 - 가장 덜 위험한 게 뭘까요? - 확실해지기 전에는

translation.en: Well I don't like to go with those scenarios yet until it's an absolute.
translation.ko: - 가장 덜 위험한 게 뭘까요? - 확실해지기 전에는 그런 시나리오를 따르고 싶지 않아요

translation.en: I understand. I, you know, I can't imagine
being in that situation. And I understand that.
-That's... -Yeah. Until we're there...
[Steve] An hour later, Justin has stabilized.
Well, I think the decision, pretty much, is if he acutely desats again,
translation.ko: 산소포화도가 또 갑자기 떨어지면 위층으로 올라가서

translation.en: he's going upstairs for bypass.
And if Mom refuses to send him upstairs again,
then she needs to change his DNR.
She needs to change his resuscitation status.
And the final path reports I believe are not, are still pending.
translation.ko: 최종 계획 보고서는 아직 안 나온 거로 알아요

translation.en: I was talking to her last night about,
"I don't have any good options for you, but these are the options that..."
and she really was not ready to hear that unless it's, you know, that time.
translation.ko: 그랬더니 그때가 되기 전엔 듣고 싶지 않다고 하더군요

translation.en: I think the fundamental issue is one of, when does one stop?
translation.ko: '언제 중단할 것인가'가 근본적인 문제인 것 같아요

translation.en: And if this is hard for us, it's impossible for them.
translation.ko: 우리에게도 힘든데 가족은 말도 못 하게 힘들죠

translation.en: It's a very difficult situation.
[Dale] We weren't there just to make him comfortable.
translation.ko: 저스틴을 편하게 해 주려고 거기 간 게 아니에요

translation.en: We were there to save our kid.
It was a commitment to him to do everything possible.
translation.ko: 가능한 모든 걸 해 주겠다고 약속했죠

translation.en: [Jennifer] You know I don't think it's humane to let a person lay there
translation.ko: 사람을 눕혀 놓고 천천히 죽게 만드는 건

translation.en: and slowly die.
I don't think it's humane at all.
